text: welcome to the Airbus defence and space
Mars yard this is a facility where we're
trying to recreate basically the
conditions on Mars in terms of the sand
and the rocks and the terrain and the
reason we're doing that is we're trying
to test out the locomotion system the
wheels and the bogies and the suspension
on the rover and we're trying to test
out the autonomous guidance and control
system that runs on top of that so
essentially this Rover is designed so
that ground control was at the beginning
of a day can simply say drive to a place
70 meters away and the rover just goes
and does it itself it analyzes train
looks at the rocks works out where to go
so what we've just done here where the
rover is currently sitting is we've said
go to another place in the Mars yard and
it's used the cameras on top of its mass
to look in three different positions
around the rover and it's built up a 3d
terrain model of the terrain so the
rover is set here and it's looking this
direction and we can see here we've got
this blue color means it's sort of nice
flat low-lying terrain and here in these
Reds areas are the big sort of slope and
rocks we've got to the left hand side of
the rover at the moment so as you can
see here we've asked the rover to drive
across the Mars yard and there's a large
boulder in the way so it's detected that
Boulder analyzed it and found a clear
path around the boulder and once it's
round it's just then on its way again
analysing the terrain and moving off to
where we've told it to go we hope that
all this will enable the scientists
working on this mission to get their
instruments to places that they want to
go and hopefully that will result in
some significant scientific discoveries
such as finding evidence of life on Mars
